title: What is Working at Height?
body:
Working at height means working in any place where, if there were no precautions in place, a person could fall a distance liable to cause personal injury.

In a kitchen, this usually means using a ladder or step stool to reach high shelves or change a light bulb.

title: Ladder Safety
body:
- **Check it:** Is the ladder damaged? Are the feet rubberized?
- **Place it:** On firm, level ground.
- **Use it:** Maintain three points of contact (two feet, one hand). Don't overreach.
- **Don't:** Stand on the top step or use a chair/crate instead of a ladder.

title: Falling Objects
body:
It's not just you fallingâ€”it's things falling on you.

- Store heavy items on lower shelves.
- Don't stack boxes too high.
- Be careful when retrieving items from height.

stem: You need to reach a high shelf. What should you use?
rationale: Only use equipment designed for the job. Crates and chairs are unstable.

title: Module Complete
body: Stay grounded. If you must work at height, use the right kit and check it first.
